page.title: 17Farming-Poultry-Hillhead
page.content: Hillhead and Smithycroft are owned by the Beaton family and are part of a unit which also includes Airyhillock. These 313 acres have been in the family for 22 years. Although the unit is run as a mixed farming unit,the main enterprise is poultry.They keep 17 500 Warren breed hens which eat 16 tons of food per week and produce 83 000 eggs per week. The hens are bought in at 18 weeks old and are housed in cages for their laying life which is approx.11 months. Mr Beaton also keeps 350 fattening cattle which he buys as calves at ten days old and keeps for 18 months till slaughtering.Barley to feed the cattle and grass are the main crops.
